headline: U.S. video game spending fell 6% y/y in February, says Circana

Spending so far this year is 11% lower than 2024 year-to-date, at $9.0B. Video game content spending in February fell 4% vs YA, to $4.0B. Its GAAP profit of $1.11 per share was 3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Electronic Arts Q2 Earnings: EPS Beat, Solid Bookings, Football's $1 Billion Run In Sight & More
summary: Electronic Arts Inc. (NASDAQ:EA) shares traded higher premarket on Wednesday after the company reported second-quarter results. The company reported net revenue of $2.025 billion, missing the consensus of $2.037 billion. EPS of $1.11 exceeded the estimate of $0.88. Net bookings reached $2.079 billion, a second-quarter record that surpassed the top end of the guidance range of $2.050 billion. headline: Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) Beats Q3 Sales Targets But Quarterly Guidance Underwhelms
summary: Video game publisher Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) reported revenue ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in Q3 CY2024, with sales up 5.8% year on year to $2.03 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $1.95 billion was less impressive, coming in 12% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $1.11 per share was also 24.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Electronic Arts: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot
